intro: Klainedoxa tripyrena, commonly known as the Three-lobed Cabbage, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and fleshy, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
